channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid vaccine: Tate Modern and The Oval open pop-up clinics
item.description: Pop-up vaccination clinics are opening across England this weekend including at The Open golf tournament.

item.title: Kingskerwell: Man dies after being hit by ambulance on 999 call
item.description: The pedestrian died in hospital after being hit by an ambulance "en route to an emergency", police say.

item.title: McDonald's blockade: Arrests as Animal Rebellion protest continues
item.description: Four people are arrested as a burger factory protest enters its third day.

item.title: Stansted Airport: Delays on M11 after lorry overturns
item.description: The southbound carriageway of the M11 is closed and emergency services are at the scene.

item.title: Bereaved sister's call for breast cancer taskforce
item.description: Inspired by the Covid vaccine, a woman is calling for a similar focus on a breast cancer cure.

item.title: UK weather: Heat-health alert issued in England for weekend
item.description: Public Heath England wants people to look out for those who may be at risk in warmer weather.

item.title: Mystery 19th Century botanist tracked down following appeal
item.description: Pressed flowers and a poem found inside a centuries-old botany book sparked a quest to find the owner.

item.title: Showman doctor: From travelling fairgrounds to the Covid frontline
item.description: Doctor John Castle says his nomadic childhood helped prepare him for the pressures of the pandemic.

item.title: Covid: Fully jabbed arrivals from France must still quarantine
item.description: A planned relaxation of England's rules from Monday will not apply due to cases of the Beta variant.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How are young people responding to the jab?
item.description: The Covid vaccine is now being offered to all over 18s. So what has uptake been like for young people?

item.title: RNLI lifeguards braced for 'busiest ever summer' on UK beaches
item.description: A Margate lifeguard says she has received extra training to manage crowds of staycation visitors.

item.title: Brick Dinos: Lego dinosaurs go on display in Norwich
item.description: The worlds of dinosaurs and Lego collide as thousands of bricks recreate a land that time forgot.

item.title: Sarah Everard murder: Met Police sacks Wayne Couzens
item.description: The disciplinary process for Wayne Couzens was held as soon as possible, the Met Police says.

item.title: Knitted Sandringham tribute goes on display at Queen's home
item.description: Margaret Seaman, 92, says it will be the "icing on the cake" if the Queen is able to see her work.

item.title: Stone man charged with racially abusing Rio Ferdinand
item.description: He is accused of using racist words and gestures against the ex-footballer at Molineux.

item.title: Finedon family reunited with ornament 35 years after burglary
item.description: Celebrity vicar the Reverend Richard Coles helped solve the mystery surrounding the item.

item.title: Jordan Banks: Police horse named after boy hit by lightning
item.description: The horse is named after Jordan Banks, who was struck by lightning while at football training.

item.title: Alan Bircher: Former medallist among swimming coaches suspended
item.description: It follows a review sparked by concerns raised by parents of swimmers at Ellesmere College Titans.

item.title: Durham A1 crash: Three killed in six-vehicle collision
item.description: A lorry driver has been arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving.

item.title: Southern Water boss's £500k bonus criticised by MP
item.description: Ian McAulay is awarded the sum despite Southern Water's £90m fine for deliberate sewage spills.

item.title: 'If the boat sinks I'll still be smiling'
item.description: A man who spent five months living in a London doorway makes his new home on a renovated boat.

item.title: Manchester author achieves dream thanks to literacy classes
item.description: Karen Woods was illiterate at 39 but has now published 21 novels and teaches creative writing.

item.title: Covid-19: 'I don't have a choice now. I'm getting on the Eurostar'
item.description: Fully vaccinated travellers returning to England and Wales from France will still have to quarantine from Monday.

item.title: Retired Cleckheaton gardener brightening up the streets of home
item.description: Retired gardener Peter Fawcett wants to brighten up his local high street in Cleckheaton.

item.title: Blyth: Ball basket tribute for Sheba the German Shepherd
item.description: German Shepherd Sheba passed away and her owners are paying tribute at the field she loved.

item.title: Car thief who drove down railway still at large
item.description: The Land Rover Discovery was driven on railway tracks before it was abandoned.

item.title: Shane Mayer: Three jailed over fatal Darlaston stabbing
item.description: Shane Mayer was stabbed after police said a seemingly "innocuous" situation quickly escalated.

item.title: Sunderland and South Tyneside NHS staff asked to postpone holidays
item.description: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Trust says it has "robust contingency plans in place".

item.title: Ashton-Under-Lyne: Baby hurt in Asda ceiling collapse
item.description: A witness says "the roof started peeling towards us, dust was everywhere and a baby was screaming".

item.title: Wiltshire man who lost wife and mother to Covid urges caution
item.description: Charles Persinger, from Wiltshire, says it is too soon to relax restrictions.

item.title: Marcus Rashford mural graffiti 'not racial', say police
item.description: Greater Manchester Police say officers are keeping an "open mind" about the possible motive.

item.title: Oldham Council leader car fire: Police make second arson arrest
item.description: A 22-year-old man is arrested after Oldham Council leader Arooj Shah's car was set on fire.

item.title: Three Huddersfield men jailed for raping teenage girl
item.description: The three men targeted the girl after spotting her on a paper round, police say.

item.title: Ex-Cleveland Police media boss Will Green admits indecent child images
item.description: Former Cleveland Police communications manager Will Green admits making 79 indecent images.

item.title: World's fastest diesel locomotive will run again at Ruddington
item.description: The diesel locomotive is being restored so it can transport passengers on a heritage railway.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks will no longer be compulsory in England from 19 July, but will remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Covid: What do over-18s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The vaccine rollout is now available for younger adults. What do they need to know about getting jabbed?

item.title: How many cases in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: British Grand Prix: Max Verstappen tops final practice before sprint qualifying
item.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen ended the final practice before Formula 1's new 'sprint' qualifying race fastest at the British Grand Prix.

item.title: Arsenal to sign Brighton's Ben White in £50m deal
item.description: Arsenal agree a deal in principle for the £50m transfer of Brighton and England defender Ben White.

item.title: England v Pakistan: Liam Livingstone hundred not enough in first T20
item.description: Liam Livingstone's spectacular 42-ball hundred cannot prevent England from being beaten by Pakistan in a riotous first Twenty20 at Trent Bridge.
